title: Projects
text:
Here you can find all the projects that I am currently working on. Most of them are R-based and my focus lies in making solid statistics and psychological methods available to everyone. If you happen to find a mistake somewhere, have ideas for further features or just want to gush about the beauty of Open Code don’t hesitate to contact me!





Project
Description




Statistik Picker
Study Tool for learning statistics in a fun and accessible way. It provides explanations as well as fun simulations and interactive tools (currently only in German). It can even be installed as an app on mobile devices!


Psychological Research with R
An online book targetted at psychology students starting to learn R. From installation to a finished, automated statistical report in R Markdown, it covers all the basics needed to really profit from R knowledge!


dropR package
R package to facilitate dropout analysis by condition. Dropout is an important measure to determine participants' motivation and also validity of results. This package & web app are to help make dropout analysis a routine step of data analysis in research.


rextor package
R package to help read in WEXTOR data into R. Offers help with basic data preperation as well as styling graphical output and basic help from Rex right inside of R Studio!

title: First Blog Post
text:

Yay!

title: Anni Tave Overlander
text:
Welcome to my corner of the internet! ✨
I am a Ph.D. candidate in Methods of Psychology and I am a bit of a statistics and R nerd. Feel free to contact me using the options below or learn more about my academic career.
You can also learn more about my Projects - maybe some of it will help you or your students?

title: Blog
text:
What’s New with Stats Picker


One of the first projects that I started during my Ph.D. is now shining in a new light!


I’m excited to announce the latest update to the Statistik-Picker app, now featuring complete English translations and enhanced mobile functionality! Check it out under the-tave.shinyapps.io/Statistik-Picker

title: Reflecting on a first PhD Year
text:
Looking back, what do you wish you had known before starting your PhD?

freedom = self-management

title: Reflecting on a first PhD Year
text:
Looking back, what do you wish you had known before starting your PhD?

freedom = self-management

title: Reflecting on a first PhD Year
section: Challenges (or What nobody tells you about doing your PhD)
text:
Challenges (or What nobody tells you about doing your PhD)
What has been the biggest challenge during your PhD, and how did you overcome it?

working in a big research team with different schedules & priorities

communication is absolutely key and so is figuring out what you need how & when

financing can be hard so applying for grants and stipends is really important (and looks good on a resume ;))

title: Reflecting on a first PhD Year
text:
Resources and Support
What resources or support (e.g., from KRS) have been particularly helpful for you?
In general I very much appreciate the culture here at the University of Konstanz. Everyone from the admin staff e.g., is so nice and helpful which is not always a given in my experience. So I can’t really name just one resource, it’s really a combination. In our department specifically, we have a lovely departmental advisor who is always there for questions, so knowing that has been a huge help!
When it comes to more academic support, I love the Get S*** Done Days organized by the Doctoral Researcher Council as well as collaborative writing times. Especially when working on writing a paper and prioritizing focused work, it is wonderful to have peers around you, concentrated and working on their own projects for motivation and moral support!

title: Reflecting on a first PhD Year
section: If you could wish for one thing to make the PhD experience even better, what would it be?
text:
If you could wish for one thing to make the PhD experience even better, what would it be?

more conferences?
more time with supervisor? (too shady???)

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text: Originally developed in German, the Statistics Picker now offers a fully translated English version, making it accessible to a broader audience. This enhancement ensures that users worldwide can utilize the app without language barriers.

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text: Originally developed in German, the Statistics Picker now offers a fully translated English version, making it accessible to a broader audience. This enhancement ensures that users worldwide can utilize the app without language barriers.

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text:
Progressive Web App (PWA) Capabilities
Experience the convenience of accessing Statistics Picker directly from your mobile device.

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text:
How to Use the App

Access the App: Visit Statistics Picker on your preferred device.
Install as PWA: On mobile devices, tap the “Add to Home Screen” option in your browser settings to install the app.
Select Language: Choose between German and English based on your preference.
Navigate: Follow the on-screen instructions to input your data characteristics.
Receive Recommendations: Obtain tailored suggestions for statistical methods suitable for your analysis.
Dive Deep: Read up on statistical procedures and build up or refresh your knowledge.
Look at the Data: Experience distributions and statistical testing with digestible simulations on different topics.

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text:
About the Stats Picker
The Statistics Picker is a user-friendly tool designed to assist students and professionals in selecting appropriate statistical methods for their data analysis needs. With an intuitive interface and comprehensive guidance, it simplifies the decision-making process in statistical analysis.
It also offers a more in-depth explanation section (Deep Dive) as well as many different Simulations, more of which are continuously added. Stay tuned for a simulation on how p-values originate!

title: What’s New with Stats Picker
text:
Feedback and Support
Your feedback is invaluable in enhancing the Statistics Picker. Feel free to share your thoughts or report any issues by contacting me through the app’s About section or send me an e-mail at overlander@uni.kn
Stay tuned for more updates and features aimed at improving your statistical analysis experience!
